str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To separate from; mid: I part; pass: To be swept aside. From apo and chorizo; to rend apart; reflexively, to separate.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To roll, roll up, fold up. A form of heilisso; to coil or wrap.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
An island. Probably from the base of naus; an island.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To set in motion, move, remove, excite, stir up. From kio; to stir, literally or figuratively.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
